c74object.name: somax.audiocorpusbuilder
c74object.digest: Build somax corpora from audio files
c74object.description: The somax.audiocorpusbuilder is used to construct a corpus from an audio file. A somax.player cannot read an audio file directly, it requires the audio to be analyzed and segmented before being able to parse it. The somax.audiocorpusbuilder does exactly that â€” it segments the audio file and analyzes it with regards to a number of descriptors and exports the result as a separate file, that then can be loaded into a somax.player.

method.name: bpm
method.description:
The bpm message, followed by a tempo value in BPM, will provide the somax.audiocorpusbuilder with an estimate of the initial tempo of the corpus to be segmented.
Note: this is only used when using beat-related timestretchmode in the somax.player. Providing this value is therefore not mandatory.

method.name: build
method.description:
The build message will cause the somax.audiocorpusbuilder to build the specified corpus according to the used segmentation parameters. There are two supported formats for this message: build path/to/audiofile.wav or build path/to/audiofile.wav corpus_name. Once build, the corpus will be available in the selected corpuspath to load in any somax.player. When the build is successfull, the corpuspath of the built corpus is output by the somax.audiocorpusbuilder out its first outlet. The value -1 is output instead if the build fails.
Note: if no explicit corpus_name is provided, the corpus will have the same name as the audio file.

method.name: copy
method.description: The copy message controls the Copy Audio File toggle available in the somax.audiocorpusbuilder window, enabling it with copy 1 and disabling it with copy 0. The state of this toggle determines whether the audio file that the corpus is constructed from should be copied to the corpuspath folder along with the .pickle file generated from its segmentation.

method.name: corpuspath
method.description: Set the path for the folder in which the segmented corpus should be saved. When a corpus is build, the current corpuspath is output by the somax.audiocorpusbuilder out its first outlet. The value -1 is output if the build fails.

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump all current parameter values on the fourth outlet
method.description: The dump message will cause the somax.audiocorpusbuilder to output the current values of all its parameters out its fourth outlet.

method.name: gainthresh
method.digest: Set peak gain threshold in audio corpus segmentation
method.description:
If the segmode is set to Onset, the message gainthresh, followed by a float, will set the value for the peak gain threshold. This parameter controls how much a peak in the audio signal must differ (in amplitude) from its surrounding samples in order to be considered a peak.
For polyphonic content, a low value (~0.07) is a good solution to detect many peaks, while for monophonic content or content with clear onsets, a higher value (~0.3) can be used.

method.name: mindur
method.digest: Set minimum segment duration (ms) in audio corpus segmentation
method.description: If the segmode is set to Onset, the message mindur, followed by a float, will set the minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) between two consecutive onsets. This parameter is useful to avoid too short slices.

method.name: openwindow
method.digest: Open audio corpus builder parameters window
method.description: Open the somax.audiocorpusbuilder window, with access to a user interface to control all the parameters of the segmentation. It's recommended to use this user interface to build the corpus, as it allows to test the segmentation and to listen to the it before building the corpus.

method.name: overwrite
method.description:
The overwrite message controls the Overwrite existing toggle available in the somax.audiocorpusbuilder window, enabling it with overwrite 1 and disabling it with overwrite 0. If this toggle is active, and a corpus with the same name exist in the current corpuspath, the corpus file will be overwritten.
Note: this will not overwrite any audio file, only the (.pickle) corpus file.

method.name: reset
method.digest: Reset default parameters for audio corpus segmentation
method.description: Resets the parameters of the somax.audiocorpusbuilder to their default values.

method.name: seginterval
method.digest: Set interval duration in audio corpus segmentation
method.description: If the segmode is set to Interval, this message controls the duration in milliseconds of the slices.

method.name: segmode
method.description: The segmode message controls the segmentation mode used in the somax.audiocorpusbuilder. There are two segmentation modes, selected with the following messages. The message segmode 0 sets the mode to Interval, meaning that the content is segmented at fixed intervals set by the seginterval parameter. The message segmode 1 sets the mode to Onset, where the audio file is segmented into slices by detecting onsets in the content. This is the default mode and there are a number of parameters to determine how onsets should be detected: mindur, window and gainthresh.

method.name: window
method.digest: Set peak window value (ms) in audio corpus segmentation
method.description: If the segmode is set to Onset, the message window, followed by a float, will set the minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) that controls the window over which each peak in the signal is evaluated in order to determine whether it's an onset or not. A smaller window will generally result in more detected onsets and therefore more slices.
